TopicTitle: How to interface with the internals of KSP?

Articles.Content: Hi all, I've seen several different mods (KOS, MechJeb, ProgCom, etc..) and none of them do exactly what I want. So I am wondering, is there a documented API for KSP that I can use to read and write internal runtime KSP variables? What I basically want to do is make my own programmable interface to KSP, but using standard language syntax. Thanks, -- Roger

This is what I use for reference, not sure how up-to-date it is, but I've found it very helpful: https://github.com/Anatid/XML-Documentation-for-the-KSP-API

You'll also want the Unity API reference: http://docs.unity3d.com/Documentation/ScriptReference/

And you can also have a look into the Assembly-CSharp.dll by yourself. Ofc without any documentation beside the object names. For example with visual studio's object browser (Where to find it might depend on your Visual Studio version.... View [=> Other Windows] => Object Browser; Ctrl + W, J or Ctrl + Alt + J)
